tweet: Shame.  There's an increasing body of evidence suggesting for-profit LTC residents in Ontario are more likely to die than residents of NFP and municipally run facilities.  LTC should be places to care for elders, not cash cows for investment funds.

This pandemic hits low-income racialized people the hardest.  So when the government chooses to save billions of dollars rather than save lives (paid sick leave, smaller classes & better #LTC staffing), they're telling us which lives they value & which lives they don't.

Pretty much a full month into the lockdown & nothing has gotten better in Manitoba. And guess where the majority of the deaths are from? LTC facilities. Why not do rotating isolated shifts for LTC workers like oilfield workers do? It would save lives if that's what this is about

274 days since I last hugged my dad. He is in a LTC home. I’m a teacher and get to hear kids talk about their play dates and sleepover with friends. I do everything right and can’t see my dad. No one is talking about mental health of seniors and the toll it is taking on them.

They just voted down her attempt to protect coverage for PTSD  incurred as a result of trauma in the workplace. This, on a day that leaked information from the Canadian Armed Forces suggested they are warning personnel they may suffer PTSD caring for dying seniors in LTC. Shame.

Ford's failure to invest in better care and more staff in LTC over the summer is unacceptable. These stories break my heart. The unfunded promise in Ford's budget to provide 4 hours of care per day adds insult to injury. Residents cannot wait 4 years for 4 hours of care. #onpoli
